seriesJson.title: People or puppets?
seriesJson.description: Discussions of values and ethics, modern versus traditional. Faculty from Union Theological Seminary, authors Kenneth Burke and Geoffrey Wagner, critics Edmund Fuller and Martin Dworkin, Dr. Solon Kimball and broadcaster Edward Stanley are featured.

node.title: So what's so funny?
node.description: So what's so funny? The sick joke and the functions of humor.

node.title: Who is to censor what?
node.description: Who is to censor what? Obscene literature and censorship.

node.title: Do you want to get away from it all
node.description: Do you want to get away from it all? Analysis of our adjustment to routine, boredom and escape.

node.title: Are you just getting the facts Ma'am?
node.description: Are you just getting the facts, Ma'am? Sensationalism in the press.

node.title: Are you engaged in the pursuit of misery?
node.description: Are you engaged in the pursuit of misery? The popularity of pain and suffering.

node.title: What is this thing called love?
node.description: A disccusion about sex and the mass media.

node.title: Who's conforming now?
node.description: Who is conforming now? Conformity and individualism.

node.title: Can you get away with it?
node.description: Can you get away with it? Relationship of morality to money matters.

node.title: What kind of adventure stories do you like?
node.description: What kind of adventure stories Do you like? Violence in the mass media.

node.title: Is the good life good enough?
node.description: Is the good life good enough? Religion that gets results.

node.title: How will you have your hero?
node.description: How will you have your hero? Celebrity gods and religious figures.

node.title: What's in it for me?
node.description: What's in it for me? The media's portrayal of self in society.
